home.role:
Possessing cross-domain technical and management capabilities,
committed to building efficient and user-friendly applications.
home.about_summary:
I have over 2 years of practical development experience in Web3 frontend and backend web applications, with triple practical experience as a frontend engineer, project manager, and MIS. I have worked at Mass Technology and Zhe Yu Technology. Successfully transitioning from a military and US study background, I am proficient in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and mainstream frameworks such as Angular, Vue3, and React.
I transform the discipline and execution ability cultivated in the past into workplace advantages, specializing in cross-domain communication and problem-solving. This cross-domain journey proves that I have high adaptability and enthusiasm for learning, and can create maximum value for projects with a comprehensive perspective of 'technology + management'.

about.intro_content: Hello, I am James Hsu. I am a software engineer with 2 years of practical development experience in Web3 related applications. I am currently studying at National Chin-Yi University of Technology in Taichung, continuing to learn the latest technology trends. I have participated in the development and maintenance of more than 20 projects, giving me a deep understanding of the product life cycle. I am particularly passionate about the design aspect because I believe that good technology must be paired with good user experience to exert maximum value. I look forward to bringing these experiences to your company.
about.exp_content:
ðŸ’» Professional History and Background
I have dual experience as a Project Manager (PM) and Frontend Engineer in the software technology industry, having worked at Mass Technology Co., Ltd. and Zhe Yu Technology Co., Ltd. Before entering the technology field, my career started uniquely. I served in the military for four years, mainly responsible for logistics and supply work. This experience cultivated my emphasis on discipline, planning, and execution efficiency. After retiring, I went to South Seattle College in the United States for one year of further study, and then returned to Taiwan due to family reasons.

ðŸš€ Career Transition and Skill Development
After returning to Taiwan, with a strong interest in programming, I decided to turn to software development. I first learned frontend basic technologies such as HTML and CSS through the vocational training center system and successfully obtained the Level C technician for frontend web design. After completing the training, knowing that the software industry is developing rapidly, I continued to invest time in self-learning JavaScript to meet the needs of the modern workplace. During my time as a frontend engineer at Mass Technology and Zhe Yu Technology, I participated in various projects and proficiently mastered the development and application of multiple mainstream frameworks, including Angular, Vue, and React. This experience not only accumulated solid technical strength but also gave me a comprehensive perspective from project planning to actual program development.

ðŸŒŸ Cross-domain Experience
Early service industry experience (catering, retail) and military logistics background gave me excellent communication and coordination skills, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail. These qualities became my key advantages for efficient cooperation with the team when serving as a project manager and cross-departmental cooperation. My career transition proves that I have strong motivation to learn, the ability to adapt to rapid changes, and can transform past seemingly unrelated experiences into professional value in the software development field.
